item.description:
Hello everyone,

 

This is a true story and happened today. As I was heading out after  dropping off donations at Rosie's place from last week's Boston Volunteer donation drive, I heard a homeless women requesting the person in charge for a warm scarf,  "I don't have a scarf and I really need one".  She was told they were out. I gently asked the supervisor if it was true and he said yes it was, they had no winter clothing left to give.  I said "I just brought donations". We went back to the area where I had put our donation bags, found two scarves(Thank you Julie), and brought them to the woman who needed a scarf.  By then, she was joined by a friend and we gave each of them a scarf. Then they  asked if I had gloves. A volunteer who was watching pulled out gloves from her purse and gave one of them hers. I went to my car and brought  back mine for the other woman.

 

So ladies, let's clean out our closets, there may be gloves/scarves/coats/winter hats/earmuffs sitting there that we don't use, and some woman out there could be desperately waiting for that scarf.

Here's the website for Rosie's place. They support women in underprivileged situations.

http://www.rosiesplace.org/

If you have donations and for any reason you cannot come to the event at Trident on Thursday, please email me, and we can figure out a pickup point.

 

Winter boots in good condition and unused socks are also needed.

 

The Boston Volunteers

Big enough to deliver, small enough to care

Learn more:  www.BostonVolunteer.org


Learn more about your fellow Boston Volunteers:

 

P.S. Many Boston Volunteers are friending our friend Paulette.

Who is Paulette:http://www.facebook.com/paulette.revere.7

group.name: Boston Volunteers. Big enough 2 deliver, small enough 2 care

item.name: Winter Donation Drive for Rosie's Place(Women's Clothing)
